lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/main.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run main.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* @return false if user gives command to stop bot, else returns true
System.out.println("The task index is invalid! Try again!");
System.out.println("The task index is invalid! Try again!");
throw new Duke.DukeException("Hey! You forgot what you needed to do?");
throw new Duke.DukeException("Hey! You forgot what you needed to do?");
throw new Duke.DukeException("Umm you forgot the deadline! Remember to use /by before the deadline!");
System.out.println("Make sure the date format is: d MMM yyyy");
throw new Duke.DukeException("Hey! You forgot what you needed to do?");
throw new Duke.DukeException("Hey you are missing the start date! Remember to use /from before the deadline!");
throw new Duke.DukeException("The end date is missing! Do better! Use /to!");
Event newEvent = new Event(details[0], timings[0], timings[1]);
System.out.println("Make sure the date format is: d MMM yyyy");
System.out.println("The task index is invalid! Try again!");
ui.chadOutput("Hmm? You are not making sense!");

System.out.println("I have created this file for you: " + newFile.getName());
System.out.println("You already have the file... Stop wasting my time");
System.out.println("An error has occurred when creating the file: " + e.getMessage());

* Writes data from the ArrayList into the txt file
* @param t is the ArrayList that contains data of all the tasks
System.out.println("There was an error writing the file: " + e);;
